file_content.text: You've helped enough today, I think.
Great! You're back. I take it you have the plans to the turrets, then?
Can't wait to lay my eyes on them. Can't wait to take them back to the Empire.
Take it.
Pay up.
Absolutely. You've earned it.
I pried them from the databank of a cold, whiny droid.
It was a pleasure.
Don't care how you got them. Just that you got them.
This is great news. These turrets are the future of Imperial anti-personnel weaponry. And Lord Grathan wanted to keep them all to himself!
Heh. We showed him. Can't wait to try these out on some Republic scum! Good work!
Um, not exactly.
Sorry.
Those turrets were inhumane.
I couldn't do it.
The plans were completely destroyed. There was nothing I could do.
There was a little accident.
What! Those plans were to revolutionize Imperial anti-personnel defenses!
I'm extremely disappointed. Extremely. Because now I have to report back that my mission was a failure--and it's your fault!
I don't know what to say.
Too late for that, isn't it?
Oh well.
What? My job's on the line here!
Think I care what your superiors think?
Yeah, yeah.
My fault? I'm Sith, Captain. I do what I want.
Don't talk that way to me.
Y--yes, my lord. Sorry. I didn't mean to insult you. I was out of line.
Next time, do your own job, soldier.
I have no regrets.
You're a real hotshot, aren't you?
Now, if you'll excuse me, I have to see if I can salvage this operation. Clean up this mess. Save my skin. You know.
Those turret schematics are going to revolutionize Imperial weaponry. We need them. Fast.
Shh. We have to be very careful. Lord Grathan's eyes are everywhere.
He is suspicious of all strangers. He must be blind to our doings.
I'll be very quiet, but you should tell me what you're doing here.
As you say.
Good. Can't have the mission ruined by some chatterbox alerting Lord Grathan to my presence.
Identify yourself.
Captain Bryn, Imperial Special Forces. This work requires intense concentration, a special kind of mind.
I am shrouded in darkness. I will not be seen or heard.
Fear not.
This Lord Grathan's pretty big on the dark side himself, I hear.
Show some respect, Imperial.
You're too informal.
Sorry, my lord. Meant no disrespect. I get carried away with myself sometimes, with the mission.
It's my job to come and go unnoticed.
I'm a professional.
Good. Imperial Army needs more professionals. Can't have amateurs running recon on someone like Lord Grathan.
Just poke his eyes out, then he'll really be blind.
There's an easy solution.
Not possible. Lord Grathan's a Sith. Probably kill me firs--oh. Joke. I get it. Funny. But Lord Grathan's no laughing matter.
Grathan's trouble, see. Big trouble. Mad scientist type. Likes weapons. Cyborgs. Droids. Ergonomic chairs.
My mission's to keep an eye on him. Watch for anything... suspicious. But I don't know what you're doing here.
I have business with the rogue lord.
Nothing special.
Business, eh? Like killing business, I suspect.
I'm going to storm Lord Grathan's estate.
Plotting an attack.
Figured as much. Sharp eyes, see. I can tell these sorts of things.
Just visiting my old friend, Lord Grathan.
You know, a stroll.
Can't fool me. Lord Grathan doesn't have friends--or not many.
You got a glint in your eye, like maybe you're not paying a friendly visit.
I, uh, I don't mean to be pushy, but since you're going that way, maybe you wouldn't mind helping me out.
Go on.
Not for free.
I got a little spare change for bribes and such, courtesy of Imperial headquarters.
Quickly.
See, my orders are to keep my distance and not enter Lord Grathan's place or cause any kind of ruckus.
But I'm supposed to see about a certain prototype turret design the rogue lord's supposedly acquired. Empire wants it for mass production.
What's so special about this turret?
Turret?
Don't know specifics, only that it's supposed to be pretty powerful.
What's my part?
Please, continue.
Caught your interest, huh? Good, good!
Lord Grathan's got the turrets hidden inside somewheres. I'd go looking for them myself, but orders are orders. I have to stay put.
Since you're going in, you could maybe poke around and see if you can't find the plans to those turrets.
No problem.
We'll see if I come across them.
If it happens, it happens.
That's all I ask.
Credits. Now.
You'll get your pay when you do the job.
I never turn down a chance at credits.
How can I refuse?
Good deal. That's the spirit.
The thing is, you'll never get past the turrets unless you take out a guard and get a security badge.
The security badges are the only way to stop the turrets from targeting you. Without one of those.... zzzzap! Goner.
What stops the turrets from targeting people with badges?
How do the badges work?
The security badge transmits a signal that tells the turrets the badge holder is friendly.
What?
Overheard some guards talking about one of their own who forgot his security badge. They had to scrape him off the floor.
Got it.
Good. Hate to think I was sending you off to certain death. Now it's only potential death.
So the op is: Get a security badge off a guard, find those turrets and grab the plans. Easy, right?
I'll be keeping an eye out here, right where you found me.
Shh. Can't be seen. Can't be heard. Sensitive business, this. Dangerous man, Lord Grathan.
